name: Molecular Biology
description: This course examines the design and interpretation of experiments that have led to our current understanding of the biological roles of DNA, RNA and proteins. Intended for students considering graduate or professional work in molecular biology or a related field or wanting a deeper understanding of these topics.
prerequisites: BIO120H1, BIO230H1/BIO255H1, BCH242Y1 (Note: BCH210H1 may be acceptable with permission of instructor)

instructors: J Claycomb R Collins B Funnell A Wilde
